revised_title: The Life and Innovations of David Theodore Nelson Williamson
tldr: This article is a biography of David Theodore Nelson Williamson, a renowned engineer who made significant contributions in radio technology, precision measurement, manufacturing, and automation. He is best known for his 'Williamson amplifier' and his work on the Ferranti grating measurement system. Williamson also played a crucial role in the development of Molins' cigarette-making machinery and the evolution of 'System 24', a precursor to today's automated factories. His innovations spanned various branches of engineering, making him an outstanding example of what able students can achieve despite setbacks.
